title: Barcelona's Philippe Coutinho transfer plan keeps Premier League door open
text:

Philippe Coutinho could still return to the Premier League - if Bayern Munich decide not to make his move permanent.

According to Spanish newspaper AS , Barcelona plan to offload the Brazilian playmaker permanently at the end of the season.

He departed for Bayern Munich on loan in the summer with an option for the German club to buy for a fee of around €120million.

It is claimed that even if that option is not triggered, the Catalan club have no plans for Coutinho to play for them again - meaning a move back to England could be back on the cards at the end of the season.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Coutinho switched Liverpool for the Nou Camp in a big-money move in January 2018 but struggled to make an impact in his 18 months in Spain.

He was heavily tipped to make a return to Anfield in the summer, with Tottenham , Manchester United and Arsenal also linked with bringing him back to the Premier League.

But a deal could not be completed before the English transfer deadline, with Bayern Munich eventually making their move.

(Image: REUTERS)

He has got off to a mixed start in Germany, being a regular in their starting line-up but being criticised for a lack of impact on occasions.

He still needs to prove his worth to prompt the Bundesliga giants to part with a huge fee in order to keep him permanently.

If they are not tempted to keep him, then the door will be reopened for a Premier League switch with Barcelona adamant they will move on from the attacker amid rumours they are under pressure to balance the books.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Barcelona are still believed to owe £84million for the purchase of Coutinho, who cost them £142million back in 2018.

But Liverpool are set to receive just £4.5m of the installments still outstanding, with the remainder of the fee due to be paid to a third-party lender, according to Barcelona club accounts.

Having already received £138m from the sale of Coutinho, Liverpool have reinvested in Virgil van Dijk and Alisson and could be in a position to bring him back for a lower fee next summer to add another element to their title-chasing side.
description: Philippe Coutinho's long-term future remains uncertain - and Barcelona's plans could land him back in the Premier League
